==Electronic==
 First of all, you need an Electronic Brain to control your PirateShip.

 [http://arducopter.googlecode.com/svn/images/ACQ_Electros.jpg]
 
The minimum required parts are:

 * *[http://store.diydrones.com/product_p/br-ardupilot-02.htm Ardu Pilot Mega]* (flight controller)

 * *[http://store.diydrones.com/product_p/br-0012-01.htm ArduPilot Mega IMU Shield/OilPan]* (sensor board)

 * *[http://store.diydrones.com/product_p/pr-0003-03-5cm.htm Servo cable]* (6pcs. needed to connect your rx)

The next parts are required if you are planning to use a GPS. You will need it to use the Position Hold flight mode.

 * *Magnetometer & Cable*: Use either
  * the DIYDrones one ([http://store.diydrones.com/HMC5843_Triple_Axis_Magnetometer_p/br-hmc5843-01.htm HMC5843 - Triple Axis Magnetometer Rev 1.2])
  * or  the Sparkfun one ([http://www.sparkfun.com/products/9371 Triple Axis Magnetometer Breakout - HMC5843])

 * *GPS & Cable*: Use either
   * the [http://store.diydrones.com/MediaTek_MT3329_GPS_10Hz_Adapter_Basic_p/mt3329-02.htm MediaTek one]
   * or the [http://store.diydrones.com/GS407_U_Blox5_GPS_4Hz_p/spk-gps-gs407.htm UBlox one]
   * [http://store.diydrones.com/EM_406_uBlox_Adaptor_Cable_15_cm_p/ca-0001-04.htm Cable]


 * *[http://www.sparkfun.com/search/results?term=xbee&what=products Xbee] for wireless communication*

You can purchase most parts from the [http://store.diydrones.com DIYDrones store], [https://www.aeroquadstore.com AeroQuad store], [http://www.sparkfun.com Sparkfun] in the USA, [http://store.fahpah.com/ Phi Fun Shop] in Asia, [http://www.coolcomponents.co.uk/catalog/ Coolcomponents] in the UK or [http://lipoly.de/ Lipoly] in Germany (if available).
